recipes.title: Rosemary Lemon Grilled Chicken with Strawberry Salsa

winePairing.pairingText: Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, and Sauvignon Blanc are great choices for Chicken. White meat is typically paired with white wine as to not overpower the flavor of the meat, so chardonnay and sauvignon blanc are safe choices. Chicken prepared with a tomato sauce or certainly a red wine sauce can and should be served with a red like a pinot noir. The Ghost Pines Sonoma County Napa County Monterey County Chardonnay with a 5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 27 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Ghost Pines Sonoma County Napa County Monterey County Chardonnay
productMatches.description: Selected from three of California's most recognized Chardonnay appellations, Sonoma, Monterey and Napa, our Ghost Pines Chardonnay offers expressive, fruit-forward characteristics. The artful combination of these three regions delivers baked apple, pear and lemon cream flavors, accented by an elegant finish of sweet vanilla.

recipes.instructions: In a food processor, combine all ingredients above except the chickenPulse all until you get a nice marinadePlace the chicken breasts in a bowl and cover with the marinade mixture, reserving half to baste chicken with on the grillPreheat your grill to a medium heat, about 400 degreesOnce warm, grill your chicken breasts. Cooking times will vary depending on the size of the breast but it should be about 5 minutes per side. Remember to only flip once.Remove from the grill and plate with the amazing salsa I made below.Combine all the above ingredients in a food processor and run on low until you get the salsa consistency of your choice.Serve with some grilled chicken or anything else you can dream up

steps.step: In a food processor, combine all ingredients above except the chicken
Pulse all until you get a nice marinade
Place the chicken breasts in a bowl and cover with the marinade mixture, reserving half to baste chicken with on the grill
Preheat your grill to a medium heat, about 400 degrees
Once warm, grill your chicken breasts. Cooking times will vary depending on the size of the breast but it should be about 5 minutes per side. Remember to only flip once.
Remove from the grill and plate with the amazing salsa I made below.
Combine all the above ingredients in a food processor and run on low until you get the salsa consistency of your choice.
Serve with some grilled chicken or anything else you can dream up
